data.question: What technique was used to trap both the low-spin and high-spin states of the iron(II) Hofmann spin crossover framework?
data.answer: High-pressure single-crystal X-ray diffraction.

data.question: What triggers the reversible switch between low-spin and high-spin states in iron(II) spin crossover complexes?
data.answer: A change in temperature, pressure, and irradiation with light.

data.question: True or False: The high-spin state is stabilized at high temperatures due to the larger entropy associated with the longer Fe@L bonds.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of pressure on the equilibrium temperature, T1/2(p), in spin crossover materials?
data.answer: Pressure increases the equilibrium temperature, T1/2(p), following the Clausius–Clapeyron equation.

data.question: True or False: Only a few single crystal structure determinations of SCO complexes under pressure have been reported due to the ease of conducting such experiments.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the Hofmann SCO framework [FeII(pmd)(H2O)][Ag(CN)2]2·H2O in the study of spin crossover materials?
data.answer: It displays exceptional SCO properties and shows pressure-tuneable thermal hysteretic behaviour.

data.question: True or False: The structural changes caused by the spin-transition in the Hofmann framework can be deconvoluted from thermal effects.
data.answer: True

data.question: What happens to the FeII@L bonds during the HS-LS switch in iron(II) spin crossover complexes?
data.answer: The antibonding eg orbitals are populated or depopulated, inducing a lengthening or shortening of the FeII@L bonds.

data.question: True or False: The study reported is the first to trap both spin states under identical experimental conditions using a combination of temperature and pressure.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of cooperative hysteretic behaviour in spin crossover materials?
data.answer: It confers bistability to the magnetic, optical, electrical, structural, and mechanical properties of the material.

data.question: True or False: The expansion of the unit cell and anisotropic distortion of the lattice parameters are caused by the spin-transition alone.
data.answer: True

data.question: How does pressure affect the stabilization of the high-spin state in spin crossover materials?
data.answer: Pressure destabilizes the high-spin state, increasing the energy gap with respect to the low-spin state.

data.question: True or False: The thermal-SCO exaggerated the increase in bond distances and coordination volume of Fe1 compared to the deconvoluted spin-transition.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of the LS to HS transition on the Fe1 octahedral coordination volume?
data.answer: The Fe1 octahedral coordination volume increases by 3.07 c3 (30%).

data.question: True or False: The study demonstrates the importance of deconvoluting the spin-transition from the external stimulus when describing the effect of spin crossover on the structure of materials.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the result of the spin-transition on the distortion angle of the Fe1 octahedral coordination geometry?
data.answer: The distortion angle increases from SLS = 9.2(8)88 to SHS = 22.6(2)88 after the spin-transition.

data.question: How does the spin-transition affect the unit cell volume?
data.answer: The unit cell volume increases by 32.7 c3 (2.4%) during the LS to HS transition.

data.question: True or False: The contraction of the c-axis during the spin-transition is facilitated by the network of compressible non-covalent interactions parallel to it.
data.answer: True

data.question: What changes occur in the [Fe1N6] bond lengths as a result of the LS to HS transition?
data.answer: The [Fe1N6] bond lengths lengthen by different amounts, contributing to the expansion of the polymeric chains and extension of the a and b unit cell axes.

data.question: True or False: The study presents the first SCO system in which the structural changes caused by the spin transition have been deconvoluted from the external stimulus.
data.answer: False
